Subject: Re: [junit] Will JUnit 'fail()' trip up ALL code coverage tools?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=215576703

J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>>
>>Simple question - when using the JUnit 'fail()' method to fail a test
>>when I expect an exception to be thrown (as per the JUnit
>>documentation), surely *ALL* code coverage tools will report that the
>>'fail()' statement is never executed (since my test correctly throws
>>the expected exception):
>>
>>  try {
>>    doWork();
>>    fail("Exception should be thrown - GET CODE COVERAGE WARNING!");
>>  }
>>  catch (Exception e) {
>>    // Success!!
>>  }
>>
>>Should I try and rework this code, or can I configure Clover (the tool
>>I'm currently using that causes me this problem) to tell it to ignore
>>JUnit 'fail()' calls?
> 
> 
> Why are you running code coverage on your /tests/? Are you trying to 
> test your tests?

I have also found running coverage on tests to be very useful.
We do tend to use the AssertThrow.asertThrows(...) mechanism but
also give ourselves the freedom to use ///CLOVER:ON and OFF in our
test code which we don't allow in our production code.

Cheers, Paul.
subject: Re: [junit] Will JUnit 'fail()' trip up ALL code coverage tools?
